Articles.Content:
Hello guys

for the lols I recently tried to see if I could get into orbit from Duna just with the EVA jet pack. With infinite EVA fuel, it turns out it works! Which is surprising because AFAICT there's not enough thrust to do this...or your man isn't as heavy as he looks!

Anyway I decided to do a grand tour with infinite fuel with my man, to visit and land at every place you touch down safely. It took 17 earth years but he made it. By far the trickiest thing is doing burns. You don't really know which way you're pointing, so each burn requires a bit of a 'feeler' to see if you're going (eg) prograde. (Also, the camera has major gimbal lock problems.) It actually became pretty good fun doing this. I tried different landing techniques, and as all burns are totally manual long burns to be caught in an SOI means you can burn long before reaching the SOI. For example, getting into Moho orbit needed 3+ km/s of dV. I burnt for a long time before reaching the SOI, constantly adjusting the orientation to keep the periapsis just where I wanted. This is tricky when you're doing single burns with mechjeb in a real craft...

Right

- take off from Kerbin
- off to the mun, plus landing
- Minmus
- off into interplanetary space to reach Moho - with overheating on the way!
- landing at Moho
- Moho->Gilly, landing there
- Gilly->Ike, landing there
- Ike->Duna, landing
- Dres, landing
- aerobrake around Jool
- Bop, landing
- Pol, landing
- Val, and a very heavy landing there!
- a very long journey to Eeloo + landing
- a fast return to Kerbin + aerobrake
- a rendezvous with my craft...still in orbit! (he hit it face first at 30 m/s)
- landing at KSC

I'll feed him next time along the route.

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/KZaRS)
Where we're going, we don't need rockets...
